tl3.database module#

tl3.database.build_parquet(tle_dir: str = None, parquet_dir: str = None, from_scratch: bool = False) → None[source]#

Builds and saves a parquet file from all the TLE files (ending in .txt) in the target directory

Parameters:

  • tle_dir (str, optional) – Target directory to search for TLEs, defaults to None (uses the default internal location ./txt/)

  • parquet_dir (str, optional) – Directory to save the parquet file to, defaults to None (uses the default internal location ./processed/)

  • from_scratch (bool, optional) – Whether to build the dataframe from scratch (necessary if the schema changes) or to append new TLEs, defaults to False

Raises:

pl.exceptions.ComputeError – If an error occurs within polars while parsing the TLE file

tl3.database.tles_between(date_start: datetime, date_end: datetime, norad_cat_id: int | str = 'all', cols: List[str] | str = '*', return_as: str = 'polars') → DataFrame | DuckDBPyRelation | ndarray[source]#
Parameters:

  • date_start (datetime.datetime) – Start datetime for the query, in UTC

  • date_end (datetime.datetime) – End datetime for the query, in UTC

  • norad_cat_id (Union[int, str], optional) – NORAD ID to query for (either a single int or “all”), defaults to ‘all’

  • cols (Union[List[str], str], optional) – SQL-style selectors for column names. Either a list of strings (ex. ["EPOCH", "INC"]), or "*" for all columns, defaults to "*"

  • return_as (string, optional) – Format to return results as. “duck” returns the raw duckdb query result, “polars” returns a polars DataFrame, and “tle” returns a numpy string [nx2] array, defaults to “polars”

  • tles_between()
